alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Knox (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:23PM EST until January 15 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River, East Fork White River. .Rainfall of 1.00 to 1.50 inches across southwestern Indiana this past Saturday night is prolonging minor flooding on the White River from near Petersburg to Hazleton. Flooding is expected to continue until the end of the week. This precipitation event also brought a short period of lowland flooding back to the Seymour area on the East Fork White River in south central Indiana. Flooding should come to an end by Tuesday morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Hazleton. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Floodwaters cover much low ground in agricultural season. Low lying oil fields...Pottsville Road and possibly a few other low rural roads flood. High water isolates Pottstown, a river cabin community. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday afternoon. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Tuesday morning by around 1100 AM CST /1200 PM EST/.
